TopicTitle: Request for Comments for a Good Snippet Service

Articles.Content:
Hi.

What would be a good service for publishing Snippets? In special, for publishing KSP.log and MM caches?

Popular ones as Pastebin have size restrictions that made it subpar to this task, and most users don't wanna to create a Github account to post their logs on an Issue. And yeah, I'm in a desperate need to a good alternative to them.  

But yet, we still need a service that would allow users to share that artifacts with the less hassle as possible.

Some people are using Google Drive, but it's cumbersome to be used for this specific task - upload the file or sync it up, then go to the web and get a link to it. Has these guys created a Desktop Extension to get a shareable link from the file's context menu, that would be the perfect solution. (Had anyone used Tortoise SVN in the past?)

Edited June 10, 2019 by Lisias
Kraken damned autocompletes! =/

1 hour ago, Lisias said:

Has these guys created a Desktop Extension to get a shareable link from the file's context menu, that would be the perfect solution.﻿

If you don't have any personal issues with dropbox, their desktop application actually adds a context menu to create a download link and if there is already one available, there is also an additional option just to copy the link to the clipboard, without the need to open any additional windows or menus

Meanwhile I post my Kopernicus and related logs on Discord...
